definition: to swing one's arms/to wash one's hands of sth
to throw/to fling/to swing/to leave behind/to throw off/to dump (sb)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
lit. arm-flinging shopkeeper/fig. sb who asks others to work but does nothing himself
to fling one's arms and stamp one's feet (in anger or despair)

sentences.english: Unlike her friends! she never gaudio-videoe up hope.
sentences.chinese: 与她的伴侣的不同之处是，她从不甩手希望。

sentences.english: The argument didn't end until Cuiping flung his hand away and left.
sentences.chinese: 这一场争吵，直到翠平猛然甩手离开他才结束。

sentences.english: I had to put down the knife, jilt a hand, take a rest.
sentences.chinese: 我只好放下刀，甩甩手，休息一下再切。

sentences.english: You can't wash your hands of this. It's your responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 这事该你负责，你可不能甩手不管。

sentences.english: What did the old woman? He tried to justify, deputy director walk away.
sentences.chinese: 什么老太太？他想辩解，副处长甩手走了。

definition: to swing one's sleeve (in anger)
to throw down/to drop (bomb)
not saying anything further (idiom); not raising any objection/without demur
to cast or put aside/to forget for a while
to pick up (from the ground with one's hands)
to turn on one's heels/to walk away abruptly
with a lightning move of the hand
to abandon
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
(onom.) bang/pop/pow
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
to select
to wave (one's hand)
to adopt an attitude/to strike a posture
to allow no explanation
to throw/to throw away
spitting anger (idiom); in a rage
